snippet: Mr. Calero played a major role in the Iran-contra scandal, lobbying in Washington for aid and testifying before Congress when it began investigating the Reagan administration’s efforts.
abstract: Adolfo Calero, leader of the American-backed contra rebels who fought Nicaragua's revolutionary Sandinista government in the 1980s, dies at age 80.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Calero played a major role in the Iran-contra scandal, lobbying in Washington for aid and testifying before Congress when it began investigating the Reagan administration’s efforts.

headline.main: Adolfo Calero, Contra Leader in Nicaragua, Is Dead at 80
headline.print_headline: Adolfo Calero, Contra Leader In Nicaragua, Is Dead at 80
